channel.title: Problems with editing drops for NPC
channel.description:
Tried changing the weight of the object at least 30 times. The NPC is Kbd, keeping the bones as a drop and weight as 0, adding d long to the list is where the problem begins.
The amount is 1, however the weight i have tried all sorts from 2-2500 and it still drops everytime. Any help?

item.title: Problems with editing drops for NPC
item.dc:creator: @Vibes Vibes
item.description:
@Vibes wrote:

nice yeah thats what i meant to say was compress… i always compile server before starting it.

Read full topic

item.title: Problems with editing drops for NPC
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

If I remember correctly, the weight drop ratio is also tied to whatever other items that NPC drops. You will have to compute all of them for relative drop chances.

Read full topic
item.source: Problems with editing drops for NPC

item.title: Problems with editing drops for NPC
item.dc:creator: @inspectah inspectah
item.description:
@inspectah wrote:

It wouldn’t make a different to the drop ratio if i compiled or not though right? What would be a sufficient weight to make it a rare drop?

Read full topic
item.source: Problems with editing drops for NPC

item.title: Problems with editing drops for NPC
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

provide the entire drop table

[quote=“Vibes, post:5, topic:529747”][quote author=inspectah link=topic=648501.msg4361433#msg4361433 date=1378829448]
Yeah sure;

814 1 0 593 1 0 [/quote] The weight is out of how many times the npc is killed will you get that drop roughly(maybe it is a pecentage). You have 0 which would drop everytime. If you change 0 to say 50 you then need to save it and compile your server for it to take effect :D[/quote] fyi you wouldn't need to compile the server for xml changes

Read full topic
